standard_metadata.standard_description: Display numerical data in plots on a number line, including dot plots, histograms, and box plots.

question.content: The following data points represent how many push-ups Mandy did each night before bed this week.  $35$, $32$, $31$, $34$, $35$, $35$, $35$  **Using this data, create a dot plot where each dot represents a night.**

hints.content: There were $\blue4$ nights where Mandy did $\pink{35}$ push ups.  [[☃ image 2]]

images.alt: A dot plot has a horizontal axis labeled, Number of push-ups, marked from 31 to 35, in increments of 1. The number of dots above each value is as follows: 31, unknown; 32, unknown; 33, unknown; 34, unknown; 35, 4. 35 is circled.

hints.content: [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A dot plot has a horizontal axis labeled, Number of push-ups, marked from 31 to 35, in increments of 1. The number of dots above each value is as follows: 31, 1; 32, 1; 33, 0; 34, 1; 35, 4.

question.content: The following data points represent how many goals Hank scored each lacrosse season.  $\qquad45,43,45,44,44,44,47$    **Using this data, create a dot plot where each dot represents a season.**

hints.content: There was $\blue1$ season where Hank scored $\pink{43}$ goals.  [[☃ image 2]]

images.alt: A dot plot has a horizontal axis labeled, Number of goals, marked from 43 to 47, in increments of 1. The number of dots above each value is as follows. 43, 1; 44, unknown; 45 unknown; 46, unknown; 47, unknown. 43 is circled.

hints.content: [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A dot plot has a horizontal axis labeled, Number of goals, marked from 43 to 47, in increments of 1. The number of dots above each value is as follows. 43, 1; 44, 3; 45 2; 46, 0; 47, 1.

question.content: Kai is a wildlife photographer. The following data points represent the number of his pictures that have been published in each local newspaper.  $\qquad4,6,3,6,5,5$   **Using this data, create a dot plot where each dot represents a local newspaper.**

hints.content: There was $\blue1$ newspaper where Kai had $\pink{3}$ pictures published.  [[☃ image 2]]

images.alt: A dot plot has a horizontal axis labeled, Number of pictures published, marked from 3 to 6, in increments of 1. The number of dots above each value is as follows. 3, 1; 4, unknown; 5, unknown; 6, unknown. 3 is circled.

hints.content: [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A dot plot has a horizontal axis labeled, Number of pictures published, marked from 3 to 6, in increments of 1. The number of dots above each value is as follows. 3, 1; 4, 1; 5, 2; 6, 2.

question.content: Hugo competes in fishing tournaments. The following data points represent how many fish he caught in each tournament.  $\qquad27,27,28,28,25,26,27$   **Using this data, create a dot plot where each dot represents a tournament.**

hints.content: There were $\blue2$ tournaments where Hugo caught $\pink{28}$ fish.  [[☃ image 2]]

images.alt: A dot plot has a horizontal axis labeled, Number of fish, marked from 25 to 28, in increments of 1. The number of dots above each value is as follows. 25, unknown; 26, unknown; 27, unknown; 28, 2. 28 is circled.

hints.content: [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A dot plot has a horizontal axis labeled, Number of fish, marked from 25 to 28, in increments of 1. The number of dots above each value is as follows. 25, 1; 26, 1; 27, 3; 28, 2.

question.content: The following data points represent the number of jars of honey Sandy the Bear consumed each day this week.  $\qquad1,4,2,3,0,3,2$    **Using this data, create a dot plot where each dot represents a day.**

hints.content: There was $\blue1$ day where Sandy the Bear consumed  $\pink{0}$ jars of honey.  [[☃ image 2]]

images.alt: A dot plot has a horizontal axis labeled, Number of jars of honey, marked from 0 to 4, in increments of 1. The number of dots above each value is as follows. 0, 1; 1, unknown; 2, unknown; 3, unknown; 4, unknown. 0 is circled.

hints.content: [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A dot plot has a horizontal axis labeled, Number of jars of honey, marked from 0 to 4, in increments of 1. The number of dots above each value is as follows. 0, 1; 1, 1; 2, 2; 3, 2; 4, 1.

question.content: Captain Brewster captured a pack of aliens. The following data points represent the lengths of each of the aliens' big toes (in centimeters).   $\qquad18,16,17,17,16,15,16$    **Using this data, create a dot plot where each dot represents a big toe.**

hints.content: There were $\blue2$ aliens that each have big toes measuring $\pink{17} \text{ cm}$ long.  [[☃ image 2]]

images.alt: A dot plot has a horizontal axis labeled, Length of big toe, in centimeters, marked from 15 to 19, in increments of 1. The number of dots above each value is as follows. 15, unknown; 16, unknown; 17, 2; 18, unknown; 19, unknown. Number 17 is circled.

hints.content: [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A dot plot has a horizontal axis labeled, Length of big toe, in centimeters, marked from 15 to 19, in increments of 1. The number of dots above each value is as follows. 15, 1; 16, 3; 17, 2; 18, 1; 19, 0.

question.content: The following data points represent the number of losses the Minnesota Igloos have had each season.   $\qquad10,9,12,10,11,12,11$   **Using this data, create a dot plot where each dot represents a season.**

hints.content: There were $\blue2$ seasons where the Minnesota Igloos had  $\pink{12}$ losses.  [[☃ image 2]]

images.alt: A dot plot has a horizontal axis labeled, Number of losses, marked from 9 to 12, in increments of 1. The number of dots above each value is as follows. 9, unknown; 10, unknown; 11, unknown; 12, 2. Number 12 is circled.

hints.content: [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A dot plot has a horizontal axis labeled, Number of losses, marked from 9 to 12, in increments of 1. The number of dots above each value is as follows. 9, 1; 10, 2; 11, 2; 12, 2.

question.content: Lola is the coach for the Golden County football team. Below are the number of  wins that the football team had in each of the last six seasons.    $5,4,7,6,7,5$  **Using this data, create a dot plot where each dot represents a season.**

hints.content: There were $\blue2$ seasons where the Golden County football team had $\pink{5}$ wins.  [[☃ image 2]]

images.alt: A dot plot has a horizontal axis labeled, Number of wins, marked from 4 to 7, in increments of 1. The number of dots above each value is as follows: 4, unknown; 5, 2; 6, unknown; 7, unknown. 5 is circled.

hints.content: [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A dot plot has a horizontal axis labeled, Number of wins, marked from 4 to 7, in increments of 1. The number of dots above each value is as follows: 4, 1; 5, 2; 6, 1; 7, 2.

question.content: Adam is an opera singer. Below are  the number of times that his voice cracked during each of six concerts.    $1,0,3,0,2,1$   **Using this data, create a dot plot where each dot represents a concert.**

hints.content: There were $\blue2$ concerts where Adam's voice cracked exactly $\pink{1}$ time.  [[☃ image 2]]

images.alt: A dot plot has a horizontal axis labeled, Number of voice cracks, marked from 0 to 3, in increments of 1. The number of dots above each value is as follows. 0, unknown; 1, 2; 2, unknown; 3, unknown. 1 is circled.

hints.content: [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A dot plot has a horizontal axis labeled, Number of voice cracks, marked from 0 to 3, in increments of 1. The number of dots above each value is as follows. 0, 2; 1, 2; 2, 1; 3, 1.

question.content: Tanya is a car saleswoman. Below are the number of cars that she sold in each of the last six months.    $23, 21, 21, 20, 21, 20$  **Using this data, create a dot plot where each dot represents a month.**

hints.content: There was $\blue1$ month where Tanya sold $\pink{23}$ cars.  [[☃ image 2]]

images.alt: A dot plot has a horizontal axis labeled, Number of cars sold, marked from 19 to 23, in increments of 1. The number of dots above each value is as follows. 19, unknown; 20, unknown; 21, unknown; 22, unknown; 23, 1. 23 is circled.

hints.content: [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A dot plot has a horizontal axis labeled, Number of cars sold, marked from 19 to 23, in increments of 1. The number of dots above each value is as follows. 20, 2; 21, 3; 23, 1.

question.content: Below are  the number of siblings that each of Sarah's six friends has.    $4, 1, 0, 3, 2, 2$  **Using this data, create a dot plot where each dot represents a friend.**

hints.content: $\blue1$ of Sarah's friends has $\pink{3}$ siblings.  [[☃ image 2]]

images.alt: A dot plot has a horizontal axis labeled, Number of siblings, marked from 0 to 4, in increments of 1. The number of dots above each value is as follows. 0, unknown; 1, unknown; 2, unknown; 3, 1; 4, unknown. Number 3 is circled.

hints.content: [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A dot plot has a horizontal axis labeled, Number of siblings, marked from 0 to 4, in increments of 1. The number of dots above each value is as follows. 0, 1; 1, 1; 2, 2; 3, 1; 4, 1.

question.content: Quarterback Susie has a bad attitude and often gets fined for bad sportsmanship. Below are the costs of each of the six  fines assessed to her this season (in thousands of dollars).     Cost of fine | Number of fines :-: | :-:  $1$ | $1$ $2$ | $4$ $3$ | $1$  **Using this data, create a dot plot where each dot represents a fine.**

hints.content: There was $\blue1$ fine that cost $\pink{3}$ thousand dollars.  [[☃ image 2]]

images.alt: A dot plot has a horizontal axis labeled, Cost of fine, in thousands of dollars, marked from 0 to 4, in increments of 1. The number of dots above each value is as follows. 0, unknown; 1, unknown; 2, unknown; 3, 1; 4, unknown. 3 is circled.

hints.content: [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A dot plot has a horizontal axis labeled, Cost of fine, in thousands of dollars, marked from 0 to 4, in increments of 1. The number of dots above each value is as follows. 0, 0; 1, 1; 2, 3; 3, 1; 4, 0.

question.content: Lena is training to be a  hairstylist.  Below are the number of haircuts that she gave during each of her eight training shifts.    Number of haircuts | Number of shifts :-: | :-:  $15$ | $3$ $16$ | $2$ $17$ | $2$ $18$ | $1$  **Using this data, create a dot plot where each dot represents a training shift.**

hints.content: There were $\blue3$ training shifts where Lena gave $\pink{15}$ haircuts.  [[☃ image 2]]

images.alt: A dot plot has a horizontal axis labeled, Number of haircuts, marked from 15 to 18, in increments of 1. The number of dots above each value is as follows. 15, 3; 16, unknown; 17, unknown; 18, unknown. Number 15 is circled.

hints.content: [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A dot plot has a horizontal axis labeled, Number of haircuts, marked from 15 to 18, in increments of 1. The number of dots above each value is as follows. 15, 3; 16, 2; 17, 2; 18, 1.

question.content: Below are the number of walks that each of Carrie's eight dogs has been on in the last week.    Number of walks | Number of dogs :-: | :-:  $5$ | $1$ $6$ | $2$ $7$ | $3$ $8$ | $1$ $9$ | $1$  **Using this data, create a dot plot where each dot represents a dog.**

hints.content: $\blue2$ of Carrie's dogs each went on $\pink{6}$ walks in the last week.  [[☃ image 2]]

images.alt: A dot plot has a horizontal axis labeled, Number of walks, marked from 5 to 9, in increments of 1. The number of dots above each value is as follows. 5, unknown; 6, 2; 7, unknown; 8, unknown; 9, unknown. 6 is circled.

hints.content: [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A dot plot has a horizontal axis labeled, Number of walks, marked from 5 to 9, in increments of 1. The number of dots above each value is as follows. 5, 1; 6, 2; 7, 3; 8, 1; 9, 1.

question.content: Melanie went on an enchanted walk through the Magical Rain Forest.  The frequency table below shows the number of legs that each of the eight creatures she saw had.    Number of legs | Number of creatures :-: | :-:  $0$ | $2$ $1$ | $1$ $2$ | $3$ $3$ | $2$  **Using this data, create a dot plot where each dot represents a creature.**

hints.content: Melanie saw $\blueD2$ creatures that each had $\maroonD{0}$ legs.  [[☃ image 2]]

images.alt: A dot plot has a horizontal axis labeled, Number of legs, marked from 0 to 3, in increments of 1. The number of dots above each value is as follows. 0, 2; 1, unknown; 2, unknown; 3, unknown. 0 is circled.

hints.content: [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A dot plot has a horizontal axis labeled, Number of legs, marked from 0 to 3, in increments of 1. The number of dots above each value is as follows. 0, 2; 1, 1; 2, 3; 3, 2.

question.content: The frequency table below shows how many hours Kim worked each weekend since she started her new job.  Number of hours | Number of weekends :-: | :-: $8$ | $1$ $9$ | $3$ $10$ | $2$ $11$ | $1$  **Using this data, create a dot plot where each dot represents a weekend.**

hints.content: There were $\blueD2$ weekends where Kim worked $\maroonD{10}$ hours.    [[☃ image 2]]

images.alt: A dot plot has a horizontal axis labeled, Number of hours, marked from 8 to 11, in increments of 1. The number of dots above each value is as follows. 8, unknown; 9, unknown; 10, 2; 11, unknown. Number 10 is circled.

hints.content: [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A dot plot has a horizontal axis labeled, Number of hours, marked from 8 to 11, in increments of 1. The number of dots above each value is as follows. 8, 1; 9, 3; 10, 2; 11, 1.

question.content: The frequency table below shows the number of trick-or-treaters at   Cam's house each year since he started putting pumpkins in his yard.  Number of trick-or-treaters | Number of years :-: | :-:  $53$ | $1$ $54$ | $2$ $55$ | $1$ $56$ | $2$   **Using this data, create a dot plot where each dot represents a year.**

hints.content: There were $\blueD2$ years where Cam had $\maroonD{54}$ trick-or-treaters.  [[☃ image 2]]

images.alt: A dot plot has a horizontal axis labeled, Number of trick-or-treaters, marked from 53 to 56, in increments of 1. The number of dots above each value is as follows. 53, unknown; 54, 2; 55, unknown; 56, unknown. 54 is circled.

hints.content: [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A dot plot has a horizontal axis labeled, Number of trick-or-treaters, marked from 53 to 56, in increments of 1. The number of dots above each value is as follows. 53, 1; 54, 2; 55, 1; 56, 2.

question.content: Elaine often gets hit by birds when she goes jogging. The frequency table below shows the number of birds that hit her during each jog this week.  Number of birds | Number of jogs :-: | :-:  $0$ | $1$ $1$ | $0$ $2$ | $1$ $3$ | $3$ $4$ | $1$  **Using this data, create a dot plot where each dot represents a jog.**

hints.content: There was $\blueD1$ jog on which  $\maroonD{0}$ birds hit Elaine.  [[☃ image 2]]

images.alt: A dot plot has a horizontal axis labeled, Number of birds, marked from 0 to 4, in increments of 1. The number of dots above each value is as follows: 0, 1; 1, unknown; 2, unknown; 3, unknown; 4, unknown. 0 is circled.

hints.content: [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A dot plot has a horizontal axis labeled, Number of birds, marked from 0 to 4, in increments of 1. The number of dots above each value is as follows: 0, 1; 1, 0; 2, 1; 3, 3; 4, 1.

question.content: The frequency table below shows the resting heart rates (in beats per minute) of each of the eight players on the Michigan Tigers basketball team.    Resting heart rate (in beats per minute) | Number of players :-: | :-:  $80$ | $2$ $81$ | $2$ $82$ | $3$ $83$ | $1$  **Using this data, create a dot plot where each dot represents a basketball player.**

hints.content: $\blueD3$ basketball players have a resting heart rate of  $\maroonD{82}$ beats per minute.  [[☃ image 2]]

images.alt: A dot plot has a horizontal axis labeled, Resting heart rate, in beats per minute, marked from 80 to 83, in increments of 1. The number of dots above each value is as follows. 80, unknown; 81 unknown; 82, 3; 83, unknown. 82 is circled.

hints.content: [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A dot plot has a horizontal axis labeled, Resting heart rate, in beats per minute, marked from 80 to 83, in increments of 1. The number of dots above each value is as follows. 80, 2; 81 2; 82, 3; 83, 1.

question.content: The frequency table below shows how many months old each of Jimmy's nine children was when they began to walk.    Number of months old | Number of children :-: | :-:  $9$ | $2$ $10$ | $3$ $11$ | $2$ $12$ | $2$   **Using this data, create a dot plot where each dot represents a child.**

hints.content: $\blueD3$ of Jimmy's children were $\maroonD{10}$ months old when they began to walk.  [[☃ image 2]]

images.alt: A dot plot has a horizontal axis labeled, Number of months old, marked from 9 to 12, in increments of 1. The number of dots above each value is as follows. 9, unknown; 10, 3; 11, unknown; 12, unknown. Number 10 is circled.

hints.content: [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A dot plot has a horizontal axis labeled, Number of months old, marked from 9 to 12, in increments of 1. The number of dots above each value is as follows. 9, 2; 10, 3; 11, 2; 12, 2.

question.content: The frequency table below shows the number of pets Jamal's classmates own.  Number of pets | Number of classmates :-: | :-:  $0$ | $3$ $1$ | $4$ $2$ | $3$ $3$ | $0$ $4$ | $1$  **Using this data, create a dot plot where each dot represents a classmate.**

hints.content: $\blueD3$ of Jamal's classmates own $\maroonD{0}$ pets.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A dot plot has a horizontal axis labeled, Number of pets, marked from 0 to 4, in increments of 1. The number of dots above each value is as follows. 0, 3; 1, unknown; 2, unknown; 3, unknown; 4, unknown. 0 is circled.

hints.content: [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A dot plot has a horizontal axis labeled, Number of pets, marked from 0 to 4, in increments of 1. The number of dots above each value is as follows. 0, 3; 1, 4; 2, 3; 3, 0; 4, 1.
